In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's a simple implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia. This function will iterate over the words in the string and add a new line each time the maximum text width would be exceeded.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    line_width = 0

    for word in words
        if line_width + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_width = 0
        end

        wrapped_text *= word * " "
        line_width += length(word) + 1  # +1 for the space character
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
text = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width=20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output:

```
This is a long
string that needs
to be wrapped.
```

Each line in the output has a maximum of 20 characters, as specified by the `text_width` argument.
